attributes.body: This app has all the relevant Open Source AI tools available. The key part is that it works on your device only - it is not sharing any of your information. We need more of this and we need to be wary of these big companies that don‚Äôt give us the privacy we should have. Thank you Think for putting our privacy first when it comes to AI.

attributes.body:
First of all think it‚Äôs kind of odd that when you click on ‚Äúapp support‚Äù for this app‚Äôs iOS AppStore page, you go to the developer website. But it has absolutely nothing to do with this app whatsoever. It‚Äôs in Swedish and has random facts on the page such as getting a corona dog (ie. Getting a dog during Covid). So that in and of itself is pretty odd. Also not sure how this app can claim to offer all of these features 100% free with no ads and no data collected. That‚Äôs a good thing if true but can‚Äôt understand how this can be accomplished in today‚Äôs AI app marketplace.

Finally with the bugs: updated the app with the most recent update and tried to download the deepseek ai model. Took a lot longer than it should have especially considering ultra fast WiFi speeds, so kind of a red flag there. But after it finished downloading, tried to use it in any way I could. And the app would crash. Even something as simple as tapping in the text box where you would type causes the app to go black and crash. And then my phone started to slowdown which isn‚Äôt normal. And on top of all that my WiFi connection was mysteriously lost.

Tried deleting and reinstalling the app with the same steps above. Same occurrence. Even went so far as to reset network settings and then repeated the steps above. And same occurrence. Seems pretty odd and not sure what to make of it but if this is a bug it‚Äôs a pretty big one.
attributes.title: Found bugs with latest update

attributes.body: Das eine Modell (Lama) macht seinen Namen alle Ehre. Es generiert lahme Witze. Das andere Modell st√ºrzt auf meinen iPhone 12 immer ab.

attributes.title: No summit button any more?

attributes.body:
"As someone who relies heavily on AI chatbots for various tasks, I was really excited to try out this new chat app. The initial experience was quite impressive - the interface is sleek and user-friendly, and the AI's responses were coherent and relevant to my queries.

However, one major feature that I found to be lacking was the chat history functionality. During my conversations, I often needed to refer back to previous information or instructions that I had provided, but the app did not retain the chat history in an accessible manner. This made it difficult to pick up where I left off or review important details from our previous exchanges.

I understand that privacy and security are important considerations for AI chat apps, but having the option to view and manage my chat history would be incredibly valuable. Being able to bookmark or save key conversations would greatly enhance the usability and productivity of this tool.
attributes.title: Chat history needed

Only the fact that the current model is pretty much incomparable to the models that we use online is what makes the current version useless. Yes, that may seem harsh, but it‚Äôs a fact if we‚Äôre honest. And I‚Äôm not judging any of the bugs or UI/UX, the is all still under development.

I will gladly follow the further development of this app in the hopes that we can use other models with it and that it will improve with time.
attributes.title: The stars are for the idea

attributes.body: For running on an iPhone this app works wonders being able to converse with artificial intelligence without the Internet is really some special. I‚Äôm really happy that these developers decided to make this more accessible and share this app for free I would 100% recommend downloading this app one of the coolest technologies I‚Äôve ever seen and I hope, they keep improving it. Thank you for creating something truly amazing!!
attributes.title: I love this app finally accessible local AI

attributes.body: Think AI is a fantastic tool for anyone who values productivity and privacy. The interface is smooth and intuitive, and it's clear that the developers prioritize user security. It's a reliable app that uses your existing hardware, so it doesn‚Äôt contribute to the pollution and water consumption of the big data centers for LLMs. Highly recommend!
attributes.title: Great App For Productivity and Privacy

attributes.body: This AI is able to answer things quickly and well and at the same time doesn‚Äôt have the caveat of storing all of your queries or gathering your data. So far the answers have been high-quality and thorough without the need to connect online, which is impressive.
attributes.title: Great AI that respects privacy

attributes.body: Model seems trained with data up to 2023 events, but that‚Äôs sufficient for so many use cases. It‚Äôs intended to run local so it‚Äôs private, with the constraint that it will be slower than a Data Center version.

Pointless.

attributes.title: Unsure ü§∑

attributes.body:
I will preface this review with stating this is is free and collects zero user data so any ideas I have could be improved with future update.

The overall interface is really good. It‚Äôs super simple with nothing more than what is needed for chatting with a llm on device. It follow design notes of even the open ai ChatGPT app with suggested prompts and a clean input and well formatted chat dialog interfaces. 

The icon and name and branding are just simple clean and great all around. 

The speech to text feature is nice and stable. It doesn‚Äôt detect when you stop speaking but I‚Äôd argue that‚Äôs more accessible for if you pause to think mid way through your question. 

The simple use of color is also nice. 

Now for the areas to improve. 
The app description claims that it is a fully open source project but I cannot find an app by this branding anywhere online on public code hosting sites like GitHub or Gitlab.  Also the app listing website or app support go to a website that has no contact information or even a mention of this app at all. It‚Äôs an outdated manifest predicting what advancements apple may roll out in 2022. It‚Äôs 2024, at least follow apples guidelines and provide some contact information on your support website so end users can get ahold of the developer if needed. 

This brings up concerns of the credibility of the developer claiming no data collected and claiming the app is completely open source. Maybe the description meant the llm model used on devices is open source? I‚Äôm not sure I‚Äôll ever know which. 

Other areas for improvement would be a text to speech option for the llm responses so you could optionally hear the response. iOS has a great built in TTS frameworks that work offline too. 

The main issue with this app in its current form is just how slow it is at typing the response from the LLM.  I know some LLMs are slower that others on an iPhone but I have other offline LLM apps that run circles around how slow this app is at relaying the response. I‚Äôm not sure why it‚Äôs so slow? Maybe a artificial delay introduces from a poorly written animation? Or the model included in the app is not as optimized as some of the other open source models used in other apps. 

I was kind of thinking of making a pull request to at least add TTS and maybe fix the slow response output but without a public git repo I simply cannot help. 

Hopefully you can fix these concerns in a future update even if you keep your source code private. That‚Äôs fine too. It‚Äôs so close to being a 5 star app.
attributes.title: It‚Äôs pretty great but could be even better
